title: Tim Scott
added: The biggest hurdle was the issue of [[qualified immunity]], the protection that shields individual police officers and other public officials from lawsuits if accused of misconduct. The issue has been one of the changes sought by Democrats and one of the few that Republicans have dubbed a nonstarter. Democrat House Speaker [[Nancy Pelosi]] called the bill "inadequate" compared with the proposals offered by Democrats, but she hoped to work "in a bipartisan way to pass legislation that creates meaningful change."<ref name="usa-today-police-reform-bill">{{Cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/black-lives-matter-and-the-family-11595530123|title=GOP police bill would incentivize cities to stop using chokeholds but wouldn't ban them|date=June 17, 2020|work=[[USA Today]]|first=Christal|last=Hayes}}</ref> Pelosi later said "Republicans "understand that there's a need to get something done. ... They admit that and have some suggestions that are worthy of consideration — but so far, they were trying to get away with murder, actually — the murder of George Floyd."<ref name="nbc-police-reform-bill">{{Cite news|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/trying-get-away-murder-george-floyd-pelosi-bashes-senate-gop-n1231967|title=

'Trying to get away with murder...of George Floyd': Pelosi bashes Senate GOP policing reform bill|date=June 24, 2020|work=[[NBC News]]|first=Rebecca|last=Shabad}}</ref> Senate Minority Whip Democrat [[Dick Durbin]] refered to the police reform bill as "token" legislation.<ref name="npr-justice-act-3">{{Cite news|url=https://www.npr.org/2020/06/17/879717148/tim-scott-says-dick-durbins-token-comment-hurts-my-soul|title=Tim Scott Says Dick Durbin's 'Token' Comment 'Hurts My Soul'|date=June 17, 2020|work=[[NPR]]|first=Barbara|last=Sprunt}}</ref> Democrats ultimately blocked debate on the bill. Two Democrats, [[Joe Manchin]] of West Virginia and [[Doug Jones]] of Alabama, broke with their party to support bringing the bill up for debate, as did independent Senator [[Angus King]] of Maine.<ref name="npr-justice-act-4">{{Cite news|url=https://www.npr.org/2020/06/24/882530458/democrats-vow-to-block-gop-police-reform-bill-unless-republicans-agree-to-negoti|title=Senate Democrats Block GOP Police Reform Bill|date=June 24, 2020|work=[[NPR]]|first1=Claudia|last1=Grisales|first2=Kelsey|last2=Snell|first3=Susan|last3=Davis}}</ref>
